name: The Wakaya Club & Spa

reviews.title: 6 Star Indulgence!
reviews.text: We have just spent a week at wonderful Wakaya for the 5th time. It just gets better and better.

reviews.title: One of the best, most relaxing trips we have ever taken!
reviews.text: Accomodation is luxurious - and so well thought out. We are told the owners aim to make their guests feel they are sataying in the owners' home! They certainly succeed....

reviews.title: paradise found - truly memorable.
reviews.text: This time we stayed in the Ambassador's Bure - with another couple who travelled with us. This bure is HUGE - two enormous suites plus our own massage room and spa pool.

reviews.title: Paradise on Earth
reviews.text: Meals and wine are first class with wide use of island grown produce.

reviews.title: perfection from beginning to the end 10
reviews.text: Challenging 9 hole golf course and great walking with guide to visit historical sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This trip is one of our top 2 romantic couple’s trips of a lifetime !
reviews.title: Every Moment Is A Postcard To Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We landed at the airport in Nadi, Fiji and were instantly met by a resort representative who guided us directly to our private plane and pilot to take us to Wakaya. This private twin engine 6 seat plane is extremely well kept and very clean. The views on the way to the Wakaya Resort and Spa are not to be missed, so keep your camcorder and camera ready!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Landing in Wakaya we were met by the resort driver and truck ready to take us from the private landing strip to the resort. Driving down through the volcanic mountains and pathways, led us to a change in scenery where thousands of palm trees stand in a meadow of perfectly manicured grass, flowers, and hibiscus. Our road wound through the trees and island greenery, past the beautiful 9 hole private golf course, and tournament croquet course, past the well kept tennis courts, and revealed the entrance to our Wakaya Resort and Spa. Talk about making a spectacular entrance!
reviews.title: Unlike anywhere I have ever been. A private island treasure.

reviews.text: We were greeted with a refreshing specialty drink and a welcoming staff of very friendly people who showed us around the resort. Everything here is kept so perfect; it's almost too good to be true. The entire resort faces the ocean in a westerly view. The ocean is very, very calm as this area of the island is protected with a very long reef that extends about 3/4 of a mile out from shore. This provides a spectacular view during each night of Wakaya’s one of a kind picture perfect sunsets.
reviews.title: a paradise second to none

reviews.text: My wife and I were showed to our ocean view bures. This island cottage would be our home for the 8 days we would spend here. Our standard ocean view bure was about 1700 sq feet, and featured a full length front porch full of furniture facing the ocean, a large living room with ample full size wet bar and fridge, whole house music system and zoned air conditioning for each room. The bedroom was huge! It featured two double closets, a king size pedestal bed, and a double length desk. There was also a door that opened out to the front porch.
reviews.title: Paradise found
great resort
reviews.text: stayed at this very special property in may and the entire trip was outstanding.

reviews.text: gorgous property on a private island in fiji that is all inclusive with exception of massage at the spa.

reviews.title: perfect place for diving, relaxation, seclusion...
reviews.text: the food was great and the chef can easily open a restraunt in nyc or la and it would be packed every night.

reviews.title: Paradise on Earth and Unparalleled Service
reviews.text: the diving was included and if you dont dive, they have a 5 star padi dive shop on premises. the dive site is world class and unlike the other resorts, you dont have to sit in a rocking boat for 2 to 3 hrs to get to the site. the dive sites are two minutes from the dive shop. i had private dives everyday with a dive master. it was just him and me the whole week. if you like golf, they have a private par 3 very challenging golf course and i was able to play golf with the golf attendent who gave me free lessons and played well enough to make a living on the pga tour.

reviews.title: WAKAYA PARADISE PERFECTION
reviews.text: the island was gorgous, the people live on the island and their only job is to work for the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is superb, in virtually every respect. I've stayed in two other hotels I thought to be in its class, Tswalu in South Africa and Aman-i-Khas in India. The bure is huge, and tremendously well appointed. The shower is outdoors, and easily accommodates two. (It has only one showerhead, though, with no handheld, which would have been helpful; sometimes you just want to get clean.) The toilet is in its own WC. There are two vanities, and, oddly, we were told which was my wife’s and which mine. Even more oddly, we did as we were told. There’s a separate bedroom and living room, both huge. There's air conditioning, and it was on when we arrived, although we turned it off and left it off.
reviews.title: Instantly one of the top three hotels I've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is included with the price, and it was excellent and inventive. Some aspects of the inventiveness were amusing - there were breads at every meal, and in a week I don't think we got the same bread twice. The one food we were offered often was tuna, from the afternoon it was caught and thereafter. The one improvement I'll ask for is the wine selection. There was always something to drink, but I thought that there could have been more options, and more at a somewhat higher end.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The snorkeling right in front of the bures - beach access, with our glasses left in the room - was the best my wife and I have experienced, in terms of fish (in a week, we identified over 100 species), coral (still working on those identifications, through the photographs), and access. We were planning on spending a couple of weeks next year in Australia, first in South Australia and then on the Great Barrier Reef, where we've been before. We've revised our plans. A week in South Australia, and a week at Wakaya.
reviews.title: Very special place

reviews.text: I almost do not want to review this place because it's so wonderful I want to keep it a secret. It was literally a paradise for us. The pace of island life slowed entirely with the phenomenal understated elegant service. The staff is genuine & lovely. The food is fresh from the garden or sea & incredibly well done. The dive team is incredible & the diving is world class. There is nothing I would change about this place. The lack of glitz and emphasis on intimate service was a game changer in how we see fine travel now. And the friendships we made with the others staying there will always be special to us. It's a remarkable place worth every dime. Par excellence.
reviews.title: A PLACE TO GET AWAY FROM IT ALL

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 7 days on our honeymoon. Every day we were there was even more amazing than the next! It's easy to get used to the relaxed atmosphere at this place!
reviews.title: A glimpse of what we all hope paradise should be.

description: The Wakaya Club & Spa is a luxury private island resort unlike any other in the world. This serene retreat in Fiji offers gracious living, sophisticated cuisine and unparalleled leisure opportunities in one of the most remote and pristine corners of the world.Ten free-standing waterfront Fijian suites or bures. Each bure is a luxurious hideaway located just steps from the Pacific ocean and is designed to indulge you in the beauty of the island while providing every conceivable comfort. Rates include all meals, beverages and 2 dives per day per certified diver. Couples Breeze Spa Retreats, Golf, Tennis, Snorkeling, fitness centre, Village Church and much more to explore on this 2,200 acre private island.
